articles.title: Army Day of DPRK Observed Abroad
Day of Sun Commemorated in At Least 80 Countries
articles.content:
Army Day of DPRK Observed Abroad 
    Pyongyang, May 1 (KCNA) -- Film shows took place at Malaysian companies and Indonesian companies and in the Czech Republic from April 20 to 24 on the occasion of the 74th anniversary of the heroic Korean People's Army.
 The attendants of the film shows watched "Korean People's Army, Steel-like Ranks", "65th Anniversary of Heroic Korean People's Army", "Order No. 027" and other Korean films.    
 Appreciating the films were officials and people of all social standings.

articles.title: Friendly Meetings Held at DPRK Missions
articles.content:
Day of Sun Commemorated in At Least 80 Countries 
    Pyongyang, May 1 (KCNA) -- The April holiday of the DPRK was significantly commemorated in at least 80 countries this year, too.
 In order to significantly commemorate the Day of the Sun at least 50 countries and international organizations inaugurated preparatory committees with high-ranking officials of political and public circles and international organizations as their chairmen.
 The National Association of Writers and Artistes of Peru registered President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il as honorary chairmen of the association in high praise of their shining feats performed for the development of the national culture and presented Kim Il Sung with the grand medal and certificate of the "Sun of the National Association of Writers and Artistes of Peru." The chairman of the Swiss Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea presented the three generals of Mt. Paektu with gifts and the honorary manager of the "Voluntad" Publishing House of Ecuador presented Kim Jong Il with a gift.
 The Cambodian king, the Guinean president, the minister of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Cuba, governments, armed forces, political parties and organizations, institutions and individuals of different countries sent floral baskets and bouquets to DPRK missions in their countries.    
 More than 300 commemoration events including meeting, seminar, round-table talks, lecture, photo exhibition and film show took place in India, Equatorial Guinea, Switzerland, Peru, Ecuador and many other countries and regions and at international organizations.

articles.title: Lift of Step for Disconnecting Internet Sites Demanded
Military's Move to Hurl Forces into Phyongthaek under Fire
articles.content:
Lift of Step for Disconnecting Internet Sites Demanded 
    Pyongyang, May 1 (KCNA) -- The Internet Journalists Association of south Korea and Internet homepage Minjok Thongsin in the United States reportedly held a joint press conference in Seoul on April 26 at which they strongly demanded the south Korean "government" lift the step for disconnecting the Internet sites and stop the unreasonable suppression of the press.
 Speakers at the press conference accused the south Korean "government" of instructing the "Ministry of Information and Telecommunications" in November 2004 to totally cut off the connections of 31 Internet sites opened by overseas Koreans on the groundless charges of being "pro-north sites" and having taken no measures in this regard since then.    
 A written demand for the lift of the measure for cutting off the connections with Internet press of overseas Koreans was read out at the press conference.
 The action taken by the south Korean authorities to cut off the connections of Internet sites with the overseas national press is hardly understandable, the message charged, urging the authorities to lift such step as soon as possible.

articles.title: Japanese Government Urged to Apologize and Compensate A-bomb Victims
articles.content:
Military's Move to Hurl Forces into Phyongthaek under Fire 
    Pyongyang, May 1 (KCNA) -- Press conferences were reportedly held one after another in front of the building of the "Ministry of National Defence" in Seoul on April 26 in protest against the south Korean military authorities' move to hurl forces into Phyongthaek area of Kyonggi Province, an area to be offered for the expansion of the U.S. military base.
 Representatives of organizations under the All-People Measure Committee for Checking the Expansion of the U.S. Military Base in Phyongthaek held a press conference to be followed by a press conference by the Seoul Council of Measures against the Expansion of the U.S. Military Base in Phyongthaek.
 At least 40 women's organizations also held a press conference at which it declared in the name of women its opposition to the expansion of the military base aimed at tightening the south Korea-U.S. "alliance" for aggression and increasing the danger of a nuclear war.    
 The Catholic Priests Council for Justice held a meeting at Taechu-ri, Phaengsong Township of Phyongthaek City, Kyonggi Province, on April 27 at which it called upon the public circles of south Korea to turn out in the struggle to frustrate the move of the military authorities to use forces for requisitioning land.
